summary: An email from a U.S. Attorney's Office representative to defense attorney Jay Lefkowitz, informing him that the Deputy Attorney General has determined federal prosecution of Jeffrey Epstein is appropriate and setting a deadline of June 30, 2008, for Epstein to comply with a plea agreement, including pleading guilty, being sentenced, and surrendering to serve his sentence.

persons.name: Jay Lefkowitz
persons.context: Addressee of the email, representing Jeffrey Epstein in legal negotiations with the U.S. Attorney's Office.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the matter, who is being told he must comply with a plea agreement by June 30, 2008, or face federal prosecution.

connections.description: Lefkowitz is the attorney representing Epstein in negotiations with federal prosecutors regarding a plea deal.

events.title: Deadline for Epstein Plea Compliance
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein has until the close of business to comply with the terms of his agreement with the United States, including entering a guilty plea, being sentenced, and surrendering to begin his prison sentence.

events.title: U.S. Attorney's Modification Letter
events.description: The U.S. Attorney sent a letter modifying the agreement between the United States and Jeffrey Epstein.

keyFacts: The Deputy Attorney General completed a review and determined federal prosecution of Jeffrey Epstein was appropriate.
Epstein was given a firm deadline of June 30, 2008, to comply with a pre-existing plea agreement.
Compliance required Epstein to plead guilty, be sentenced, and surrender to begin serving a prison sentence.
The agreement had been previously modified by a letter from the U.S. Attorney on December 19, 2007.
